description: Ensure your Spring Boot app works correctly.

slides.title: Spring Boot Test üß™
slides.content:
# starter-test

`spring-boot-starter-test` includes everything you need:
- **JUnit 5:** The standard test framework.
- **Mockito:** For mocking dependencies.
- **AssertJ:** Fluent assertions (`assertThat`).
- **Hamcrest:** Matcher objects.

slides.title: @SpringBootTest
slides.content:
# Integration Test üîå

Loads the COMPLETE application context.

Simulates starting the whole app.

Great for identifying configuration issues, but slow.

slides.title: @WebMvcTest
slides.content:
# Slice Test üç∞

Loads ONLY the web layer (Controllers).

Mocks the Service and Repository layers.

Focused and much faster than `@SpringBootTest`.

slides.title: @DataJpaTest
slides.content:
# Repository Test üíæ

Loads only JPA components.

Configures an in-memory database (H2) automatically.

Rolls back transactions after each test (clean slate).

slides.title: MockMvc
slides.content:
# Fake Requests üé≠

Used to send HTTP requests to your controllers without starting a real server.

`mockMvc.perform(get("/users"))`
`  .andExpect(status().isOk())`

slides.title: Annotation Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which annotation is used to test ONLY the Controller layer?

slides.title: @MockBean
slides.content:
# Mocking dependencies üÉè

Replaces a real bean in the Spring Context with a Mockito mock.

Great for isolating the component you are testing from its dependencies (e.g., Mocking `UserService` while testing `UserController`).

slides.title: TestContainers
slides.content:
# Real Dependencies üê≥

Instead of H2 (fake DB), use Docker to spin up a REAL Postgres/MySQL container for tests.

Ensures your tests run against the exact same technology as production.

slides.title: SpyBean
slides.content:
# Spying üïµÔ∏è

Wraps a real bean to track interactions (verify methods were called) without completely replacing its logic.

slides.title: JSONPath
slides.content:
# Parse JSON üîç

Used with MockMvc to inspector specific fields in the JSON response.

`.andExpect(jsonPath("$.name").value("John"))`

slides.title: Tool Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What tool allows running real databases (like Postgres) in Docker containers during tests?

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Testing üß™

Fail fast.

- **@SpringBootTest:** Full integ.
- **@WebMvcTest:** Controllers.
- **@MockBean:** Mock dependencies.
- **TestContainers:** Real env.
